name: Christian Bernier
summary: CS + Physics Student at Northeastern University
biography: Hello! I'm a third-year honors student at Northeastern University pursuing a degree in computer science and physics, with a minor in mathematics. Below, you can find more information about my educational background, personal projects I've made, and my professional experience. Please don't hesitate to reach out to say hi!

schools.title: Northeastern University
schools.subtitle: Khoury College of Computer Sciences
schools.summary: Candidate for Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Physics
courses: Fundamentals of Computer Science I and II

projects.title: Graphical Image Processing and Enhancement Application
description: Developed GUI application to manipulate and analyze image files using Java Swing for Object-Oriented Design class
Utilized model-view-controller design with kernel filtering and linear color transformation classes for easy editing
Explored object-oriented principles such as the Builder, Command, Adapter, Decorator, and Strategy design patterns

projects.title: Physics Notes Generator
description: Created a static site generator to parse my physics notes from Markdown/LaTeX into HTML using NodeJS
Boosted productivity of study sessions significantly by making notes easy to access and well-organized

projects.title: Special Relativity
description: Made an interactive spacetime diagram to visualize Lorentz transformations used in special relativity
Implemented various equations used in modern physics to provide an intuition behind the math of relativity

projects.title: Gerrymander Me!
description: Built a game in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to demonstrate the effects of partisan gerrymandering
Delivered an engaging and interactive experience to over 100 students in AP U.S. Government classes

projects.title: Lissajous Curves
description: Developed an interactive tool to visualize complex harmonic motion found in physical systems
Provides users the ability to change parameters of the systems and observe how the resulting patterns are affected

projects.title: MBTA Wiki
description: Created a reference website and iOS app to track trains and buses on Boston public transit network
Generated over 1,000 iOS app downloads and thousands of website pageviews with reliable and useful information
Learned HTML, JavaScript, CSS, and React to present third-party API data in a fast and organized way

projects.title: 3D Fractal Visualizer
description: Developed an interactive program to visualize complex 3D fractals using for AP Computer Science class with a partner
Utilized distance estimator and ray-marching rendering methods in Java/C program with LWJGL library for graphics

experience.title: Software Engineering Co-op
description: Developed full-stack features used billions of times daily for a cloud security product in an agile scrum team
Designed and implemented extensible user interfaces and APIs in various large-scale Git codebases independently
Contributed to team discussions about software design and independently reviewed others’ code changes in GitHub

experience.title: Teaching Assistant
description: Ensure a complete understanding of computer science lecture material by hosting 4 drop-in office hours per week
Mentor 40 students weekly in 100-minute lab periods by proctoring interactive activities and answering questions
Grade several homework and exam assignments per week through code reviews with meaningful feedback

experience.title: In – Gallery Learning Program Assistant
description: Engage thousands of visitors of all ages daily in drop-in engineering, computer science, and biology activities
Educate visitors about the engineering design process and encourage planning, testing, and redesigning
Manage and coordinate dozens of interns and volunteers to ensure a flawless visitor experience

experience.title: Peer Tutor
description: Mentor students in multivariable calculus, fundamentals of computer science, and modern physics
Conduct up to 10 one-on-one meetings weekly, leading to higher student confidence and better in – class performance

experience.title: Chemistry Intern
description: Prepared dozens of compound samples for NMR analysis and refilled machines with liquid nitrogen weekly
Organized and weighed thousands of chemical samples to expedite drug discovery for neurodegenerative diseases

experience.title: Media Technology and IT Intern
description: Upgraded software, storage, and memory in servers and end-user machines, which greatly increased productivity
Created deployment documentation for new and refurbished computers and other IT equipment
Troubleshot issues with AV equipment in front of thousands of church attendees
